intro: Cardaminopsis arenosa var. simplex, commonly known as the simple rock白菜, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky environments in Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in crevices and on rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, with a pinnate structure, and it produces yellow flowers in late spring. This species is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
